Protoss](#Vs._Protoss) * [4.3 Vs. Terran](#Vs._Terran) * [4.4 Vs. Zerg](#Vs._Zerg) * [5 Gallery](#Gallery) * [6 Quotes](#Quotes) * [7 Patch Changes](#Patch_Changes) * [8 References](#References) Description\[[edit](/starcraft2/index.php?title=Banshee_(Legacy_of_the_Void)&action=edit§ion=1 "Edit section: Description")\ \] ---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- The **Banshee** is a strong Air-to-Ground unit that is built from a [Starport](/starcraft2/Starport "Starport") with a [Tech Lab](/starcraft2/Tech_Lab#Starport "Tech Lab") add-on. The Banshee has a number of common uses. Used early on in any match-up, they can catch an opponent off guard and allow for uninterrupted harassment, especially if [Cloak](/starcraft2/Cloak "Cloak") has been researched. For this reason, hiding two Starports can be devastating for an opponent if left unscouted. When supported by [Vikings](/starcraft2/Viking "Viking") , Banshees can be used to form a very powerful air army that can be very hard for Protoss to deal with. Increases the movement speed of Banshees from 3.85 to 5.25. | Competitive Usage\[[edit](/starcraft2/index.php?title=Banshee_(Legacy_of_the_Void)&action=edit§ion=4 "Edit section: Competitive Usage")\ \] ---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- ### General\[[edit](/starcraft2/index.php?title=Banshee_(Legacy_of_the_Void)&action=edit§ion=5 "Edit section: General")\ \] * A Banshee can fire off salvos of rockets rather quickly, and one shot from two of them will kill any worker in one hit. Thus, if built early, upgraded with Cloak, and properly microed to only fire at mineral gatherers, they can destroy an opponent's entire economy within seconds. This strategy is highly unlikely to work more than once, since the enemy will be very careful with his detectors and workers after such a devastating attack. * Since [Wings of Liberty](/starcraft2/Wings_of_Liberty "Wings of Liberty") , Banshees worked, when rushed, as a precursor to a 2-3 [Siege Tank](/starcraft2/Siege_Tank "Siege Tank") push or a faster-than-normal 3rd mining base, in match-ups when openings til mid-game did not include a [Spire](/starcraft2/Spire "Spire") , [Stargate](/starcraft2/Stargate "Stargate") or [Starport](/starcraft2/Starport "Starport") in any fashion, many players would simply get [Detection](/starcraft2/Detection "Detection") and ground-based anti-air; hence Siege Tanks being effective for the range advantage. * Since the introduction of the [Liberator](/starcraft2/Liberator "Liberator") in Legacy of the Void, amongst other economic changes, Banshees have declined in popularity, as the liberator is able to one-shot workers by itself, is 50 gas cheaper than a pair of banshees, and does not require an attached tech lab. ### Vs.[![](https://liquipedia.net/commons/images/thumb/e/e4/ProtossIcon.png/30px-ProtossIcon.png)](/starcraft2/File:ProtossIcon.png) Protoss\[[edit](/starcraft2/index.php?title=Banshee_(Legacy_of_the_Void)&action=edit§ion=6 "Edit section: Vs. Protoss")\ \] Against Protoss, Banshees can be a devastating attack force due to relatively weak anti-air capabilities of the Protoss Army. On the ground that a single [Shield Battery](/starcraft2/Shield_Battery "Shield Battery") recharges shield much faster than damage dealing of several banshees, a minimum number of 2 banshees is recommended to one-shot [Probes](/starcraft2/Probe "Probe") . The Cloaking ability of the Banshee can lead to surprise attacks should the Protoss not have [Observers](/starcraft2/Observer "Observer") accompanying their army, or any detection around their mineral lines. ### Vs.[![](https://liquipedia.net/commons/images/thumb/9/94/TerranIcon.png/30px-TerranIcon.png)](/starcraft2/File:TerranIcon.png) Terran\[[edit](/starcraft2/index.php?title=Banshee_(Legacy_of_the_Void)&action=edit§ion=7 "Edit section: Vs. Terran")\ \] Banshees are a common opener in TvT, especially with [Cloak](/starcraft2/Cloak "Cloak") , due to its ability to outmicro [Marines](/starcraft2/Marine "Marine") and the potential to inflict significant damage to an opponents economy. However, they are vulnerable to [Vikings](/starcraft2/Viking "Viking") , [Missile Turrets](/starcraft2/Missile_Turret "Missile Turret") and especially [Cyclones](/starcraft2/Cyclone "Cyclone") combined with [Ravens](/starcraft2/Raven "Raven") . Without either speed upgrades which is the common situation, banshees remain the same moving speed as cyclones', hence once targeted by Lock On banshees are unable to leave without the help of cliffs or other terrains. If you can gain air dominance, they can be used to snipe key units from the opponent's ground army, usually [Siege Tanks](/starcraft2/Siege_Tank "Siege Tank") , without much resistance. However, the main usage for Banshees remains harassment. Banshees do find a "niche" use for resource harassment in the mid-late game after researching hyperflight rotors. Still, they're far less common than [Liberators](/starcraft2/Liberator "Liberator") . If the opponent neglected placing Missile Turrets in his base, a couple of Banshees can devastate vulnerable mineral lines and/or coerce him into sacrificing an [Orbital Command](/starcraft2/Orbital_Command "Orbital Command") 's energy for [Scanner Sweeps](/starcraft2/Scanner_Sweep "Scanner Sweep") that could otherwise have been invested into [MULEs](/starcraft2/MULE "MULE") . ### Vs.[![](https://liquipedia.net/commons/images/thumb/d/d1/ZergIcon.png/30px-ZergIcon.png)](/starcraft2/File:ZergIcon.png) Zerg\[[edit](/starcraft2/index.php?title=Banshee_(Legacy_of_the_Void)&action=edit§ion=8 "Edit section: Vs. Zerg")\ \] Banshees can be somewhat effective in ZvT, although [Spore Crawlers](/starcraft2/Spore_Crawler "Spore Crawler") , [Queens](/starcraft2/Queen "Queen") and [Hydralisks](/starcraft2/Hydralisk "Hydralisk") \* can buy enough time for [Mutalisks](/starcraft2/Mutalisk "Mutalisk") to come out, at which point Banshees shouldn't be used because they lack any anti-air capabilities. A Banshee can defeat one [Queen](/starcraft2/Queen "Queen") , and with Cloak this becomes a non-issue. Zerg players can use the semi-mobile [Spore Crawler](/starcraft2/Spore_Crawler "Spore Crawler") turret for both damage and detection, in combination with Queens, or upgrade to [Lair](/starcraft2/Lair "Lair") have access to [Overseer](/starcraft2/Overseer "Overseer") [Detectors](/starcraft2/Detector "Detector") as well as the major Zerg anti-air unit, the [Hydralisk](/starcraft2/Hydralisk "Hydralisk") . A successful Banshee rush can transition into an immediate end-game, or set the Terran player far ahead in the macro while his Zerg opponent recovers. Against early game [Roach](/starcraft2/Roach "Roach") \-based rushes banshees are quite essential since neither [Roaches](/starcraft2/Roach "Roach") , [Ravagers](/starcraft2/Ravager "Ravager") or [Zerglings](/starcraft2/Zergling "Zergling") can target air units. However banshees are vulnerable to some [Queen](/starcraft2/Queen "Queen") \-dropping rushes. _\*Note: Hydralisks have 5 range (without the upgrade), while Banshees have 6 range - correct micro can mean that before the Hydralisk upgrade comes out Banshees can outrange them._ Gallery\[[edit](/starcraft2/index.php?title=Banshee_(Legacy_of_the_Void)&action=edit§ion=9 "Edit section: Gallery")\ \] -------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- [![](https://liquipedia.net/commons/images/5/50/Banshee.gif)](/starcraft2/File:Banshee.gif) Quotes\[[edit](/starcraft2/index.php?title=Banshee_(Legacy_of_the_Void)&action=edit§ion=10 "Edit section: Quotes")\ \] ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- | \[[hide](#)

Zerg](#Vs._Zerg) * [5 Gallery](#Gallery) * [6 Quotes](#Quotes) * [7 Patch Changes](#Patch_Changes) * [8 References](#References) Description\[[edit](/starcraft2/index.php?title=Banshee_(Legacy_of_the_Void)&action=edit§ion=1 "Edit section: Description")\ \] ---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- The **Banshee** is a strong Air-to-Ground unit that is built from a [Starport](/starcraft2/Starport "Starport") with a [Tech Lab](/starcraft2/Tech_Lab#Starport "Tech Lab") add-on. The Banshee has a number of common uses. Used early on in any match-up, they can catch an opponent off guard and allow for uninterrupted harassment, especially if [Cloak](/starcraft2/Cloak "Cloak") has been researched. For this reason, hiding two Starports can be devastating for an opponent if left unscouted. When supported by [Vikings](/starcraft2/Viking "Viking") , Banshees can be used to form a very powerful air army that can be very hard for Protoss to deal with. Increases the movement speed of Banshees from 3.85 to 5.25. | Competitive Usage\[[edit](/starcraft2/index.php?title=Banshee_(Legacy_of_the_Void)&action=edit§ion=4 "Edit section: Competitive Usage")\ \] ---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- ### General\[[edit](/starcraft2/index.php?title=Banshee_(Legacy_of_the_Void)&action=edit§ion=5 "Edit section: General")\ \] * A Banshee can fire off salvos of rockets rather quickly, and one shot from two of them will kill any worker in one hit. Thus, if built early, upgraded with Cloak, and properly microed to only fire at mineral gatherers, they can destroy an opponent's entire economy within seconds. This strategy is highly unlikely to work more than once, since the enemy will be very careful with his detectors and workers after such a devastating attack. * Since [Wings of Liberty](/starcraft2/Wings_of_Liberty "Wings of Liberty") , Banshees worked, when rushed, as a precursor to a 2-3 [Siege Tank](/starcraft2/Siege_Tank "Siege Tank") push or a faster-than-normal 3rd mining base, in match-ups when openings til mid-game did not include a [Spire](/starcraft2/Spire "Spire") , [Stargate](/starcraft2/Stargate "Stargate") or [Starport](/starcraft2/Starport "Starport") in any fashion, many players would simply get [Detection](/starcraft2/Detection "Detection") and ground-based anti-air; hence Siege Tanks being effective for the range advantage. * Since the introduction of the [Liberator](/starcraft2/Liberator "Liberator") in Legacy of the Void, amongst other economic changes, Banshees have declined in popularity, as the liberator is able to one-shot workers by itself, is 50 gas cheaper than a pair of banshees, and does not require an attached tech lab. ### Vs.[![](https://liquipedia.net/commons/images/thumb/e/e4/ProtossIcon.png/30px-ProtossIcon.png)](/starcraft2/File:ProtossIcon.png) Protoss\[[edit](/starcraft2/index.php?title=Banshee_(Legacy_of_the_Void)&action=edit§ion=6 "Edit section: Vs. Protoss")\ \] Against Protoss, Banshees can be a devastating attack force due to relatively weak anti-air capabilities of the Protoss Army. On the ground that a single [Shield Battery](/starcraft2/Shield_Battery "Shield Battery") recharges shield much faster than damage dealing of several banshees, a minimum number of 2 banshees is recommended to one-shot [Probes](/starcraft2/Probe "Probe") . The Cloaking ability of the Banshee can lead to surprise attacks should the Protoss not have [Observers](/starcraft2/Observer "Observer") accompanying their army, or any detection around their mineral lines. ### Vs.[![](https://liquipedia.net/commons/images/thumb/9/94/TerranIcon.png/30px-TerranIcon.png)](/starcraft2/File:TerranIcon.png) Terran\[[edit](/starcraft2/index.php?title=Banshee_(Legacy_of_the_Void)&action=edit§ion=7 "Edit section: Vs. Terran")\ \] Banshees are a common opener in TvT, especially with [Cloak](/starcraft2/Cloak "Cloak") , due to its ability to outmicro [Marines](/starcraft2/Marine "Marine") and the potential to inflict significant damage to an opponents economy. However, they are vulnerable to [Vikings](/starcraft2/Viking "Viking") , [Missile Turrets](/starcraft2/Missile_Turret "Missile Turret") and especially [Cyclones](/starcraft2/Cyclone "Cyclone") combined with [Ravens](/starcraft2/Raven "Raven") . Without either speed upgrades which is the common situation, banshees remain the same moving speed as cyclones', hence once targeted by Lock On banshees are unable to leave without the help of cliffs or other terrains. If you can gain air dominance, they can be used to snipe key units from the opponent's ground army, usually [Siege Tanks](/starcraft2/Siege_Tank "Siege Tank") , without much resistance. However, the main usage for Banshees remains harassment. Banshees do find a "niche" use for resource harassment in the mid-late game after researching hyperflight rotors. Still, they're far less common than [Liberators](/starcraft2/Liberator "Liberator") . If the opponent neglected placing Missile Turrets in his base, a couple of Banshees can devastate vulnerable mineral lines and/or coerce him into sacrificing an [Orbital Command](/starcraft2/Orbital_Command "Orbital Command") 's energy for [Scanner Sweeps](/starcraft2/Scanner_Sweep "Scanner Sweep") that could otherwise have been invested into [MULEs](/starcraft2/MULE "MULE") . ### Vs.[![](https://liquipedia.net/commons/images/thumb/d/d1/ZergIcon.png/30px-ZergIcon.png)](/starcraft2/File:ZergIcon.png) Zerg\[[edit](/starcraft2/index.php?title=Banshee_(Legacy_of_the_Void)&action=edit§ion=8 "Edit section: Vs. Zerg")\ \] Banshees can be somewhat effective in ZvT, although [Spore Crawlers](/starcraft2/Spore_Crawler "Spore Crawler") , [Queens](/starcraft2/Queen "Queen") and [Hydralisks](/starcraft2/Hydralisk "Hydralisk") \* can buy enough time for [Mutalisks](/starcraft2/Mutalisk "Mutalisk") to come out, at which point Banshees shouldn't be used because they lack any anti-air capabilities. A Banshee can defeat one [Queen](/starcraft2/Queen "Queen") , and with Cloak this becomes a non-issue. Zerg players can use the semi-mobile [Spore Crawler](/starcraft2/Spore_Crawler "Spore Crawler") turret for both damage and detection, in combination with Queens, or upgrade to [Lair](/starcraft2/Lair "Lair") have access to [Overseer](/starcraft2/Overseer "Overseer") [Detectors](/starcraft2/Detector "Detector") as well as the major Zerg anti-air unit, the [Hydralisk](/starcraft2/Hydralisk "Hydralisk") . A successful Banshee rush can transition into an immediate end-game, or set the Terran player far ahead in the macro while his Zerg opponent recovers. Against early game [Roach](/starcraft2/Roach "Roach") \-based rushes banshees are quite essential since neither [Roaches](/starcraft2/Roach "Roach") , [Ravagers](/starcraft2/Ravager "Ravager") or [Zerglings](/starcraft2/Zergling "Zergling") can target air units. However banshees are vulnerable to some [Queen](/starcraft2/Queen "Queen") \-dropping rushes. _\*Note: Hydralisks have 5 range (without the upgrade), while Banshees have 6 range - correct micro can mean that before the Hydralisk upgrade comes out Banshees can outrange them._ Gallery\[[edit](/starcraft2/index.php?title=Banshee_(Legacy_of_the_Void)&action=edit§ion=9 "Edit section: Gallery")\ \] -------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- [![](https://liquipedia.net/commons/images/5/50/Banshee.gif)](/starcraft2/File:Banshee.gif) Quotes\[[edit](/starcraft2/index.php?title=Banshee_(Legacy_of_the_Void)&action=edit§ion=10 "Edit section: Quotes")\ \] ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- | \[[hide](#)
